Text: LVCII Interconnection Agreement Cc you get this forwarded to NevadaSierra If not could you please do so ASAP We need to keep this moving with all possible speed I could do this for you but you have been the principal contact on the Agreement for continuity Let me know if there is something I could do Also as we discussed the other day we should be trying to set up a meeting with NevadaSierra as soon as practicable to work through open items Thanks Mary If this is already done let me know Forwarded by Don HammondPDXECT on PM Enron Capital Trade Resources Corp From JOHN MAAS LGMCOM PM To cc ANDREA CHAMBERS LGMCOM JOHN G KLAUBERG LGMCOM THOMAS J MOORE LGMCOM Subject LVCII Interconnection Agreement Attached is a draft of the above blacklined against the original draft we received from Nevada Power This draft also reflects comments from Dale of this evening Let me know if you need anything further at this time JM John Maas LeBoeuf Lamb Greene MacRae The information transmitted is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential andor privileged material Any review retransmission dissemination or other use of or taking of any action in reliance upon this information by persons or entities other than the intended recipient is prohibited If you received this in error please contact the sender and delete the material from any computer LVIIIAbldoc

Las Vegas Cogen II Transmission Cc Luna of Nevada Power confirmed this morning his target to issue the System Impact Study report for transmission service from Las Vegas Cogen to Mead on Friday March rd I have set up a meeting with Larry to discuss the report on Wednesday March th We will meet at pm at Nevada Powers offices in Las Vegas

Nevada Power Interconnect Agreement Cc discussed Mary we are about ready to send our edits back to Sierra Pacific for the Las Vegas Cogen II Interconnect Agreement We need to keep the process moving forward as quickly as possible To facilitate that a meeting next week I presume in Reno to work through the Agreement would be desirable The objective would be to work through open issues resolve all that can be resolved easily and identify the few if any issues that we each may need to do more work on We should target the week of April nd to have the document complete After we get the revision back from LeBoeuf tomorrow it would be good if you requested a meeting date for next week when you forward it Sometime in the first half of the week would be preferable Thanks Mary

RE Transmission Service Request Cc a status update fron Nevada Power on our transmission service request I wouldnt hazard a guess as to whether very soon means next week but they seem to be working on our request Forwarded by Don HammondPDXECT on PM Enron Capital Trade Resources Corp From Luna Larry PM To cc Whalen Brian PPCcom Subject RE Transmission Service Request Weve completed some studies but still need to check on a case or two Hope to have a breif system impact study report out to you very soon Spoke w Ops and they indicated the letter will likely go out on Original Message From mailto Sent Friday March AM To Luna Larry Cc Whalen Brian Subject Re Transmission Service Request Larry Im checking on the status of the study for our transmission service request Per your email below can we still expect to receive the results in the immediate future Also Marty had indicated in a March th email that we could expect to receive by March the documentation we had requested of Nevada Powers policy precluding use of a remedial action scheme in lieu of reconductoring What is the status of Nevada Powers Operating Department in providing that documentation Thanks Larry Embedded Enron Capital Trade Resources Corp image moved to file From Luna Larry picpcx PM To cc Whalen Brian PPCcom Subject Transmission Service Request Don Well communicate the results of our analysis regarding your transmission application by next week Per my discussion w Brian we will evaluate your request under the premise that the terms of the service may extend beyond year We will model all the valid transmission service requests ahead of ENRONs request in the study By now you should have received Martys revision to the ENRON plant interconnection scope If you have any questions please drop me a line Larry Luna

LVCOGEN MW six unit Addition Interconnection StudyAddendum Cc final hopefully addendum to the Interconnect Study from Nevada Power I havent read it thoroughly but it appears there are no surprises Forwarded by Don HammondPDXECT on PM Enron Capital Trade Resources Corp From Fisher Marty PM To cc Luna Larry Whalen Brian PPCcom Goyette Robert Torrey Sheryl Subject LVCOGEN MW six unit Addition Interconnection StudyAddendum Don The attached document ENRONMWFinalCaseJdoc contains the recommended interconnection study requirementscosts for the six new LVCOGEN units Let me know if you have any questions concerning this report addendum Thanks Marty Fisher Nevada Power Company ENRONMWFinalCaseJdoc ENRONMWFinalCaseJdoc

LVCOGEN MW six unit Addition Interconnection StudyAddendum Cc final hopefully addendum to the Interconnect Study from Nevada Power I havent read it thoroughly but it appears there are no surprises Forwarded by Don HammondPDXECT on PM Enron Capital Trade Resources Corp From Fisher Marty PM To cc Luna Larry Whalen Brian PPCcom Goyette Robert Torrey Sheryl Subject LVCOGEN MW six unit Addition Interconnection StudyAddendum Don The attached document ENRONMWFinalCaseJdoc contains the recommended interconnection study requirementscosts for the six new LVCOGEN units Let me know if you have any questions concerning this report addendum Thanks Marty Fisher Nevada Power Company ENRONMWFinalCaseJdoc ENRONMWFinalCaseJdoc

Re Change order for GE transformerPleasanton Cc files incorporating suggested revisions for the change order to Contract LMK for the purchase of a generator stepup transformer for the Pleasanton Project In lieu of the Exhibit A of the draft you sent out I have substituted Exhibit A the GE proposal dated October I have substituted Exhibit B GEs standard specifications for generator stepup transformers for the EECC specifications in the earlier draft GEs proposal is quoted on the basis of their standard GSU transformer specification I have this only in hard copy and have a call into GE to verify this is the applicable standard and whether it is available in electronic form I will give you a copy Dale The two additional documents were transmitted along with GEs proposal and I have referenced them in Part I Paragraph

Re Change Order to ABB transformer contract Cc reviewed the document My edited draft is attached Thanks Dale Dale Rasmussen AM To Don CT Catherine CT cc Jody CT Kay nron Sheila CT Subject Change Order to ABB transformer contract My draft of Change Order for the Las Vegas Cogen II transformers is attached Please let me know of any comments

Re LV CogenABB Agreement Cc gone through the Version of the ABB agreement that you forwarded I have compared it to the other versions and changes I was aware of the technical areas only I have attached a redlined version with edits Also here are my notes on each of the changes Section of the Agreement earlier versions of the Agreement contained the purchase amount here As I commented by phone by my calculation the total purchase amount for these two units would be or each By my records the original purchase amount for these units was A change was made in November that increased each unit by Another change in December increased each unit by These increase amounts were confirmed by ABB on and The Version document eliminates this purchase amount However sections and contain amounts of on the original purchase amount of one unit Should these values be changed Exhibit B Section b and c these are revisions requested by the contractor They are reasonable requests if they can be accommodated by ABB I don not know if these changes were coordinated directly between the contractor and ABB Section minimum ambient temperature Minimum ambient temperature should be minus degrees C This corresponds to degrees F the design basis temperature The minus degrees C requested by the contractor is incorrect Section Surge Arrestor rating This is a new request from the contractor It appears acceptable Section Voltage Rating This is a correction to indicate a voltage of Section Type of Cooling This is added information on type of cooling FOA as provided by ABB in thier revised data sheets The other changes in Sections and correspond to information previously provided to ABB in conference calls and communications from the contractor

Re Change order for GE transformerPleasanton Cc files incorporating suggested revisions for the change order to Contract LMK for the purchase of a generator stepup transformer for the Pleasanton Project In lieu of the Exhibit A of the draft you sent out I have substituted Exhibit A the GE proposal dated October I have substituted Exhibit B GEs standard specifications for generator stepup transformers for the EECC specifications in the earlier draft GEs proposal is quoted on the basis of their standard GSU transformer specification I have this only in hard copy and have a call into GE to verify this is the applicable standard and whether it is available in electronic form I will give you a copy Dale The two additional documents were transmitted along with GEs proposal and I have referenced them in Part I Paragraph
